You are given two integers $m$ and $b$ (where $1 \le m \le 1000$ and $1 \le b \le 10000$).  

Imagine a grid of points with integer coordinates $(x, y)$ where $0 \le x$ and $0 \le y$. Each point $(x, y)$ has a tree with $x + y$ bananas.

A line with equation $y = mx + b$ is drawn on this grid.

You can choose a rectangle with sides parallel to the axes that is entirely on or below this line.  You can cut down all the trees inside and on the border of this rectangle and collect their bananas.

What is the maximum number of bananas you can collect?

You are given a grid of points, each containing a number of items.  You can select a rectangular area on or below a given line.  Find the maximum total number of items you can collect by selecting a rectangle.
